skill.name: documentation-generator
skill.description: Auto-generate JSDoc, docstrings, README files, and API documentation.
skill.summary: Auto-generate JSDoc, docstrings, README files, and API documentation.
skill.author: CuriousLearner

security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based skill with no executable code. Only contains documentation generation instructions for AI assistants. No file access, network calls, or command execution capabilities.

content.value_statement: Writing documentation takes significant time and is often neglected. This skill automates the creation of JSDoc, docstrings, README files, and API documentation across multiple programming languages.
actual_capabilities: Generate JSDoc comments for JavaScript and TypeScript
Create Python docstrings in Google, NumPy, or Sphinx style
Write Javadoc for Java methods and classes
Create complete README files with installation and usage guides
limitations: Does not execute or modify code files directly
Cannot access local project files without explicit content sharing
Documentation quality depends on code clarity and provided context
May require manual review for complex business logic

use_cases.title: Document existing codebases
use_cases.description: Add comprehensive documentation to undocumented functions and methods in legacy projects

use_cases.title: Create project documentation
use_cases.description: Generate README files, API references, and contribution guides for public repositories

use_cases.title: Standardize documentation format
use_cases.description: Ensure consistent documentation style across multiple programming languages in a project

prompt_templates.title: Basic documentation
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the documentation-generator skill to generate JSDoc comments for the following JavaScript file:

prompt_templates.title: Document with format
prompt_templates.prompt: @documentation-generator --format google-style Generate Python docstrings for this function with type hints and examples:

prompt_templates.title: Generate README only
prompt_templates.prompt: @documentation-generator --readme-only Create a complete README.md for my project including features, installation, usage, and API reference:

prompt_templates.title: Multi-language project
prompt_templates.prompt: Use documentation-generator to document all functions in the src/utils/ directory. Apply appropriate format based on file extension (JSDoc for .js/.ts, Google style for .py, Rustdoc for .rs):

output_examples.input: Document this function: function calculateTotal(basePrice, taxRate, discount = 0)
output: Generated JSDoc comment with @param, @returns, and @throws tags
Included type information for all parameters
Added example usage showing input and output

best_practices: Provide complete function signatures and parameter types for accurate documentation
Share relevant context about edge cases and performance considerations
Request documentation in your project's existing style for consistency
Review generated documentation before committing to catch domain-specific nuances
anti_patterns: Requesting documentation for code with no comments or clear structure
Generating documentation without reviewing for business logic accuracy
Using the skill to overwrite carefully crafted custom documentation
Expecting the skill to understand undocumented internal APIs without context

faq.question: What programming languages are supported?
faq.answer: JavaScript/TypeScript (JSDoc), Python (Google, NumPy, Sphinx styles), Rust (Rustdoc), Java (Javadoc), and Go (GoDoc).

faq.question: Can this skill modify my source files?
faq.answer: No. The skill generates documentation text that you can copy and paste. It does not have file system access.

faq.question: How does the skill know my project's documentation style?
faq.answer: It defaults to standard conventions for each language. Specify your preferred style (e.g., Google-style for Python) or share existing documentation as a reference.

faq.question: Is my code data safe?
faq.answer: Yes. The skill only processes code you explicitly share in the conversation. Nothing is stored or sent to external services.

faq.question: Why does documentation look different from my existing code?
faq.answer: The skill uses standard formats for each language. Provide examples of your project's style or request specific formatting adjustments.

faq.question: How is this different from code completion features in IDEs?
faq.answer: This skill generates comprehensive documentation with examples, error handling, and context-aware descriptions. IDE completions typically only add basic signatures.
